item.title: Affan's Python Code
item.description: #sinstall.packages('reticulate') library(reticulate) my_string <- "Hi, my name is Affan Khan :)))))" Sample Python code from class PPT. list1=[1,2,3,4] list2=['a','b','c','d'] print(list1[0]) ## 1 Demonstrating Python and R Talking to One Another my_string = "I'm a UT Austin Student and I'm from Sugar Land, Texas" print(r, my_string, my_string) ## <__main__.R object at 0x123ec3198> I'm a UT Austin Student and I'm from Sugar Land, Texas I'm a UT Austin Student and I'm from Sugar Land, Texas cat(c(my_string, py$my_string)) ## Hi, my name is Affan Khan :))))) I'm a UT Austin Student and I'm from Sugar Land, Texas Germany is my favorite country in the world, here is the Neuschwanstein Castle!

item.title: Project2.Rmd
item.description: 0. Introduction # read all datasets fert_data <- read.csv("~/Desktop/SDS Project/fert.csv") head(fert_data) ## name slug fert_r ## 1 Niger niger 6.91 ## 2 Angola angola 5.90 ## 3 Congo, Democratic Republic of the congo-democratic-republic-of-the 5.70 ## 4 Mali mali 5.63 ## 5 Chad chad 5.57 ## 6 Benin benin 5.47 ## date_of_information ranking region ## 1 2021 est. 1 Africa ## 2 2021 est. 2 Africa ## 3 2021 est. 3 Africa ## 4 2021 est.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
